body:
Possibly try unticking the option to prefer the Gradle wrapper that comes with the project.  You can update the wrapper in that project later if you want to reenable that option.

cc/ @lkishalmi is there an easier way to handle this?  Maybe need a wrapper update UI?  Or am I missing there is one somewhere?
All checks have passed.
Thanks.  Yes, I noticed that, but I'm still getting a 404 from direct download.  I'm going to try a local build with your changes and see if that works here first before merging.
Maybe, we should merge this later to avoid failing CI with other PRs?

Thanks @matthiasblaesing and kudos for all the screenshots - above and beyond! :smile: Tested locally too. > I ran hard against NotificationLineSupport: It is good for very short texts and utterly fails for anyhing longer than a handful of words. Yes, you need to add `
` tags. I may look at a wrapping fix some time, but not for this! @mbien it wasn't from a DRY perspective, at least not code anyway! Icons and colours spread across the code base tend to cause problems over time. But this solves the immediate concerns for merging.
Yes, that's my concern, as well as people building locally.  Still breaks local build for me too.

> @mbien it wasn't from a DRY perspective, at least not code anyway! Icons and colours spread across the code base tend to cause problems over time.

sure DRY goes beyond code.

@tmysik Could you please have a look at this?
@neilcsmith-net Is this OK?
Looks good to me. Please, let me know if I should merge it (but I don't think so, right?). Thanks!

Thank you, guys!
@tmysik Let's merge it after CI passes.

@mbien you're reading that the opposite way to how it was intended. Code-wise it wasn't (mostly) about DRY. Anyway, this change is good to go  - any follow up discussion can happen elsewhere if need be.
Wouldn't this (or variation of it) be better in delivery?  I've just pushed a few updates to the main README for similar reasons.  Source release docs should be as current as we can be.

Hey @PashaTurok I think you mixed two different things here. One is comment support while hitting enter to add a new '*' and also the other thing to add at the end of the comment. And adding code generators for getter/setter in TypeScript.

So next time, please create one ticket for each feature. Code generator for getter and setter has nothing todo with the comments that you requested.

Anyway, I had a look into the code generation stuff and found this tutorial: https://netbeans.apache.org/tutorials/nbm-code-generator.html The problem with this tutorial is, that is is very coupled to the JavaSource class which can handle all the stuff inside a Java file to identify what is a member, what is a class, what is an interface etc. Such feature, afaik is not available for JavaScript nor TypeScript. TypeScript was the first language which was implemented with the textmate lexer and I dunno whether we already have a class where we can figure out what is a variable, class, (A parser) etc. I think also this comes from the Language Server of TypeScript, if we can get the info from the server, that could be easier to handle. There is a PHP implementation somehow but someone created an ASTNode and all other stuff directly for PHP. I jumped into this too to check what they did for PHP and maybe we can use it but I dunno. There is a global parser but the rest needs to be handled differently. I can have a look when NetBeans starts to build again.

As an alternative, we can use a 3rd-party-lib called tree-sitter and the java impl by JetBrains: https://github.com/JetBrains/jsitter. To parse a language, which is supported by this parser: http://tree-sitter.github.io/tree-sitter/. So differnet approach as ANTLR or JavaCC because you don't need to create a lexer before, I mean someone already did this but we don't need to do this by our own. So it creates a concrete syntax tree for this language. That means for all the supported languages of this parser we can try to use this and make this by our own.

@neilcsmith-net I am pretty sure we don't disagree :) I only tried to clarify that when I mentioned DRY the first time, it already included other aspects like resources in my mind, not just the few lines of UI code which could be saved.
@neilcsmith-net squashed the commits I wanted squashed and adjusted the title of the second commit to refer to the JIRA issue. Feel free to merge when this gets green.

@lkishalmi busy adding milestones as I'm reading :smile:  From a NetBeans 13 perspective, happy to merge, but wouldn't mind review from someone who actually uses this more (I use Windows rarely) given we're late in the day.
@matthiasblaesing thanks, yes, that split into two commits makes sense.  If you see it green before me, feel free to merge too.
@junichi11 this sounds like a possible culprit - https://lists.apache.org/thread/xw4o1joztm3q1gvlq9dyskfbmmbkyyty

@neilcsmith-net Just saw this one requested against the delivery branch, so I've added you as a reviewer and set the milestone to NB13. The choice is in your hands.

Also, I'm not a Windows user as well.

> The file probe however only checks windows dlls.

@mbien the Ant property `jvm.arch.string`, which this PR affects, is used only for the Windows "exe" launcher.
Also think that the old check works only on Windows because it uses backslash in the path.

Anyway, compared 32bit and 64bit **Linux** builds of Zulu and Bellsoft:

- Java 8: 32bit has directory `jre/lib/i386`, 64bit has `jre/lib/amd64` (Java 11 and 17 do not have these dirs)
- Java 11 and 17: have not found a file/directory to detect 32bit

For macOS I have not found 32bit builds.
@DevCharly yeah I agree its not needed to cover all cases here since the property is only used on windows.
@neilcsmith-net  Yes, I completely forgot to run the script this time.
Fixed.
@junichi11 no worries! :smile: All resolved, let's merge.
@junichi11 Great! Thank you very much :-)
You're welcome :)
There are no tests yet, I need to write them.
Nice! Must admit my approach to `GuaranteedValue` many years ago was to nuke the UIDefaults table entirely before switching - eg. `UIManager.getDefaults().clear()`. :shrug:
Reproducible in 13rc2. Thanks for the detailed report.

May also want to consider, if an existing issue already exists in JIRA, migrate the details when raising the Github issue.  May want to comment about the issue in equivalent JIRA ticket (maybe add a link) and close out the JIRA ticket as applicable.
pinging @sdedic since it might be caused by the updates to maven templates (I haven't checked).

~~Seems to be lack of a `src/test/java` folder, or expectation it's there. Just adding that fixes it.~~ (had missed that in the report!) Same bug is reproducible in 12.6 too.  Would be great to get fixed in 13 though.

good to know that it is already reproducible in 12.6. This means its not the fault of the new maven templates.

We should probably try to fix it in a way so that it doesn't require the empty folders. I am just wondering if other functions are also affected by not having the folder. (maybe add the folders anyway?)

@ebresie that will be up to the person (eg. original reporter / community member) if and when they migrate a ticket here.  There's no plan to mass migrate or link to older issues when we shutter JIRA.  We're following the process outlined at https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=191332632 fairly closely, including the last section on "How to migrate".

The _Profiler native binary build-windows_ is repeatedly failing. Do you think it can be because of my changes? I have renamed the cached directory - that is the only (yet unlikely) thing which could cause the profiler binaries failures.

Looks like it might have been failing for a while.  It's only triggered rarely by path.  Just done a manual trigger on master.

And fails there too https://github.com/apache/netbeans/actions/runs/1762385602

Well, there is no real workaround can be don on NetBeans side. NetBeans 12.5 does not really support running on JDK 17. We have NetBeans 12.6 for that. Also NetBeans 13 will report such issues more detailed to users.

Just briefly: Due to limitations in Gradle, it's no matter what version you set for Gradle, or JDK, the project introspection will happen with the JDK the IDE is running on, starting with the Gradle Tooling API the IDE is provided with. If the Tooling API does not support the JDK the IDE is running on, then this is what happens.
Gradle 7.3 is the first one which supports JDK 17 as runtime. We were lucky with 12.6 that Gradle released that just a few days before our last release candidate.

Sorry, @lkishalmi missed the 12.5 in there.  So, yes, @paratechnical please upgrade to 12.6, or try out a 13 rc.

However, I have noticed a similar issue on 12.6 with projects with an older wrapper and JDK 17.

This will be even more twisted (if I didn't overlook something obvious); URL returned for test source root is different when the directory physically exists (ends with /) and when it does not (without /) - which is bad of itself, as URLs are often used as map keys. I wonder why it worked in the past - going to debug 12.4 and `delivery` in parallel.
ok thanks merging regulary thnks
Thanks @DevCharly , and @mbien for review - merging.
Is this a Java 17-sim?  I see reference to small [change in 17 release notes](https://www.oracle.com/java/technologies/javase/17-relnote-issues.html#JDK-8262277) related to IllegalArgumentException.

it might be worth investigating if it would make sense to add modifiers to the `ElementHandle` API.

Removing good-first-issue label again :)

@JaroslavTulach I do what i can but a lot of this is still black magic to me :)

I am going to rebase this PR for delivery just in case it can be still integrated. This looks fairly low risk to me (I don't think the utility functions are even used in netbeans itself).

Thanks @sdedic

Delivery merges to master after each RC - once we know build is OK. I'll merge this PR into delivery now. RC3 should be built Wednesday. So, merge to master should happen by end of week.  Please hold fire on further fixes until #3515 is merged or we'll get merge conflicts.

Closing as issue fixed for 13-rc3.

@mbien added folders is a useful conversation for elsewhere.  May benefit from test and resources folders being in initial template.  Both seem to cause users confusion at times.

You mean the icons in the branding dialog, Basic section?  The UI needs an update I think as higher resolution icons have been added to the IDE.  The harness itself is OK.

Go into the branding folder, `<project>/branding/core/core.jar/org/netbeans/core/startup/` and make sure you have files for `frame256.png`, `frame512.png` and `frame1024.png`.
I didn't have those larger icons: I've added them and now everything works as expected. Without an UI update the user has no clue about the need for these image sizes.

@aldobrucale yes, caught me out the first time! Thanks for confirmation it's just the UI. Updated labelling and title. Hopefully an easy fix. although may also need consideration of SVG support. cc/ @ralphbenjamin @eirikbakke

Seems a good workaround, at least for now. Better a UI is too lax than too strict.

I've linked the issue, although we might want a follow up to-do on this.  Please at least reference the issue in the description (title is optional) so we get linkage, or it's almost as bad as dealing with JIRA! :smile:

Will wait to merge until tomorrow to allow time for other reviewers, but would like to get in rc3 if it's going in.

> This looks fairly low risk to me (I don't think the utility functions are even used in netbeans itself).

Not sure how to assess the latter point against bug criteria then, so will take your word on the first point and sneak it in rc3! :smile: Will merge tomorrow, give @jlahoda time to comment if needed.

The SVG support stuff does not affect the branding files (it's too early in the startup sequence to support SVG graphics here). 

But since after https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/1246 , you can supply a splash screen graphic that is twice the width/height of that specified in SPLASH_WIDTH/SPLASH_HEIGHT; this will make the splash screen look good on MacOS Retina screens and Windows/Linux machines with HiDPI scaling enabled. (The old "Branding"/Splash Screen panel in NetBeans doesn't really understand this new convention, though.)
it should allow apidoc to be built from the ci
We may have to fix this in delivery post-release if we're going to have these files going forward.
build ok apidoc regenerated

Hi @mcdonnell-john , Yes the problem is with 12.6. Sorry for the confusion, I also tried with 12.2 and I got the same problem. But when I looking in the apps screen I can see them and I can launch it. It works. It shows the error message, but it installs it. That is confusing

Can you uninstall it, and then try installing it again and send a copy of the installer logs? (When installing Apache NetBeans 12.6 -   press `cmd + L` ) so we can see what might be happening during the installation process?

Thanks in advance

Can confirm on Windows 10, JDK 17, NetBeans 12.6
NetBeans is creating the wrong structure.  It supposed to create a parent POM app with several children modules.  
But it creates nested apps with no parent relationship.

Sorry, closing, not enough info here. Please open an issue describing what you're doing and steps to reproduce the problem, aside from just the log, if you want someone to look at this.  Or start a discussion thread if you're not sure. Thanks!

@juneau001 could you please have a look at this? If I see this correctly, JEE 7 is still implemented correctly, all the possible artifacts for JEE got their own archetypes:

- EAR: [org.codehaus.mojo.archetypes:ear-javaee7:1.0](https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.codehaus.mojo.archetypes/ear-javaee7/1.0/maven-archetype)
- EJB-JAR: [org.codehaus.mojo.archetypes:ejb-javaee7:1.1](https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.codehaus.mojo.archetypes/ejb-javaee7/1.1/maven-archetype)
- WAR: [org.codehaus.mojo.archetypes:webapp-javaee7:1.1](https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.codehaus.mojo.archetypes/webapp-javaee7/1.1/maven-archetype)
- Appclient: [org.codehaus.mojo.archetypes:appclient-javaee7:1.1](https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.codehaus.mojo.archetypes/appclient-javaee7/1.1/maven-archetype)
- Bundling POM Projekt: [org.codehaus.mojo.archetypes:pom-root:1.1](https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.codehaus.mojo.archetypes/pom-root/1.1/maven-archetype)

If I remember correctly, the EAR bundles the EJB-JAR and WAR into a single artifact and combines these into the server side artifact. The applient artifact is used by clients to access the server side resources and the POM projects wraps all these artifacts together into a manageable bundle.

With recent JEE versions the old rigid style vanished and you could bundle EJBs and Webparts into a single artifact (either an EJB jar or a WAR file ) and deploy these.

Looking at the definitions for JEE 8 + 9 I see, that all artifacts use the same archetypes and I don't see how they could generate all the artifacts described above.

TL;DR: I think the support for JEE 8 + 9 only covers only the Web Tier and the definitions for the FullProfile need to be redone.

The new project wizard is coupled with the server registry. For each application server there is a list of supported profiles and for wildfly this list is not yet updated. The right place to look for would be:

https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/master/enterprise/javaee.wildfly/src/org/netbeans/modules/javaee/wildfly/ide/WildflyJ2eePlatformFactory.java

How to reproduce means exactly what did you do? Also formatting in which filetype? Java, XML, JS, PHP, CSS, etc. Please provice as much information as we need to figure out the problem. Also it would be good to attach the errornous file that you wanted to format. And did this happen while formatting on save or when exaclty?

I will look into this project type.  However, the trend since Java EE 7 is to use WAR files and JAR files for application deployment, rather than EAR files for deployment, since they are lighter weight.  EAR files were mainly used in Java EE 7 or older.  It seems like this functionality still works if you choose Java EE 7 or below, as you had mentioned.

Do we want to make this functionality work within Apache NetBeans for Java EE 8 and Jakarta EE projects even though it is no longer a standard project format for these newer versions?

Afaik JavaEE/JakartaEE spec require backwards compatibility so the support won't go away soon.

But it seems a legitimate question if these types should be proposed by NetBeans for new projects. Afaik you still need an EAR when you bundle a resource adapter.
Sure let me do that I and will let you know
All green ! merging.

Note this PR is marked as do not merge, but did not contain more commits than the original one (#3546) from @jhorvath -- seems that GH marked it as merged when the original commit hash was merged to master. Ignore, a new PR (this time with an unique commit on top) will be created.

> There are no tests yet, I need to write them.

There is now test for the api.

You problem is not the HTML, but the broken CSS. `{$style}` is not valid CSS and that is what NetBeans marks as error. As there are also warnings on the lines, it is not obvious. You can make it easier to spot if you break the element onto multiple lines (one per attribute).

The error indicators allow you to disable CSS validation and then you should be happier.

I could reproduce the problem for the `vue.service.js` file. The issue is here the usage of an async import statement. This was added in ecmascript ECMAScript 11 - 2020 and the parser did not support that. I'm currently trying to add ecmascript 2022 support to the graaljs fork  we are using and the JS modules in NetBeans.
In the buttom there's a red icon. When you click on it you should see the occuring error with stacktrace.

Please fill in the _How to reproduce_ section as well as sharing the error / stacktrace.  What type of project?

Also try with NetBeans 13-rc3 - https://lists.apache.org/thread/5rkzr20z5n67j1jtzk0y76px5y6covmp

Is this related to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-6117 ?
Got waylaid by release stuff.  Let's merge this - see if it helps, and easy revert if it causes problems!

I never before saw this and according to the log this has happend for:

- application/xslt+xml
- text/less
- text/x-json
- text/javascript
- text/x-dtd
- text/x-form
- text/x-netbeans-layer+xml

I reverted 416e6fbc28e6bc17f88f49f12be0260a8ec7df63 and the issue is gone. So I assume the new code paths need some more love.

I think the JDK is irrelevant since it uses the `hostinfo.sh` shell script to determine the underlying system info. Which once fixed to support arm would still return arm when running a x86_64 JDK.

https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/c084119009d2e0f736f225d706bc1827af283501/ide/dlight.nativeexecution/release/bin/nativeexecution/hostinfo.sh

https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/c084119009d2e0f736f225d706bc1827af283501/ide/dlight.nativeexecution/src/org/netbeans/modules/nativeexecution/support/hostinfo/impl/UnixHostInfoProvider.java#L69

I had an initial look into it. I recognized some minor problems:

* jakarta ee platform refers old versions of configurations like web.xml 
* for war projects only web profile is available

From my understanding if I choose a war project I should be able to select javaee/jakartaee full profile. I already spent some efforts to add Jakarta EE 9.1 and fix the old versions. But I'm unsure if the limitation of web profile for war projects should be removed.

see https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/release126/enterprise/maven.j2ee/src/org/netbeans/modules/maven/j2ee/ui/wizard/ServerSelectionHelper.java#L189-L202
@tmysik Could you please have a look at this? If there is no problem, let's merge it. Thanks!
I got the same log with a PHP project. PHP features(Hints, CC, etc.) don't work correctly.

Also, until generics like `Product<Car>` is fully supported, the `<Car>` part should be ignored/stripped and `Product` should be honored, eg. handled as a non generics class, with class usage & hinting should be supported.
@tmysik Thank you for your review!
@mvorisek I like your idea, but I'd say that is out of scope of this feature request. I'd suggest to create a separate issue for that.
To my understanding (a few years old) a war deployed into a full profile server can access all JavaEE features (JMS, JCA, EJBs), so I tend to agree, that a WAR project should offer the full profile.
